intro: Atelophragma jaliscense, commonly known as the Jalisco spurge, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in scrublands or open woodlands. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
